page.title: 10RELIGION
page.content: The sole place of worship in the area is the Parish Church at Rhydycroesau. It once boasted its own parson, but since 1947 services have been presided over by the rector of the nearby village of Selattyn. Strangely the church is located to the west of the stream at Rhydycroesau, and is thus in Wales. However early in the twentieth century its parishioners were allowed to choose the destiny of their church, and opted to be part of the{Church of {England.}Our visit to the Sunday communion service in June - there were six of us - found a congregation of only six others! The Selattyn rector said that this attendance was poor by normal standards, usually between 12 and 20 being present. A small {Methodist}chapel operates nearby at Cefn Canol, and{Roman Catholics}attend church in Oswestry.
